answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Timothy – below are links to various agencies “geocaching” policies, disclaimers, etc.  I hope this is helpful:
Louisville, CO
http://forums.groundspeak.com/GC/index.php?showtopic=36267
Jefferson, MO
http://www.jeffcitymo.org/parks/geocaching.html
Brooklyn Park
http://citysearch.brooklynpark.org/website/recpark/geocache/geocache%20complete.pdf
Camdenton 
http://www.camdentoncity.com/City%20Park%20Geocaching%20Policy.pdf 
FL Geocaching Association
http://www.floridacaching.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=61 
Carrollton TX
http://www.cityofcarrollton.com/index.aspx?page=1481 
James City/County
http://www.jccegov.com/pdf/parksrecpdfs/2011documents/Geocaching_Policy_and_Permit.pdf
Detroit
http://www.ci.detroit-lakes.mn.us/publicworks/GEOCACHE-%20public%20works/geocaching_policy.htm 
Rolla City
http://www.rollacity.org/parks/geocache.shtml 
Toronto, CAN
http://www.geocaching.com/about/disclaimer.aspx
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org

author: Timothy McLean
text: I was just curious to see if anyone knows of State or Local laws that relate to "geocaching" ? I've heard that South Carolina had tried to introduce some sort of regulations against it. Mostly I am curious if anyone knows of any local ordinances that regulate or outright ban it? We have received some requests for permission to engage in this hobby in our public parks, so I wanted to see if any other organizations have addressed this issue.
title: Geocaching
